So, ask Costco to employ at least twice as many people and pay them same benefits as now. Will see how quickly Costco will go down. Yes, many in Walmart are on minimum wage. But they earn income. Nothing's wrong with that. Not happy with benefits? Apply to Costco. See how that's going to work. Both retailers are in the business to make money. They create jobs along the way. Costco makes more $$$ with less people. Costco is so rich! Why wouldn't they employ more!

Message.Title: Tea Party's Massive Waste of Tax Dollars
Message.Msg: Of the top 10 members of Congress most generous with year-end bonuses ( tax dollars ), nine were Republicans, and 14 of the top 20 were, not coincidentally, on their way out of the House. Allen West and Todd Akin routinely decried wasteful and out-of-control government spending, calling for major cuts to social programs. Akin nearly doubled the salaries of his House staffers in the quarter after his defeat, according to the website LegiStorm, which tracks congressional pay. Allen West, a Tea Party favorite from South Florida, was the fourth biggest giver of taxpayer bonuses after he lost reelection to Rep. Patrick Murphy (D-Fla.). Rep. Chip Cravaack (R-Minn.) was the third most generous, according to LegiStorm. Hypocrisy is the main platform of the GOP !

Can you make a single coherent point? If you close all Walmart stores and replace them with Costco, we will be sitting with hundreds of thousands more unemployed. Not to mention, Walmart has much larger variety of products. I shop at Costco for 13 years. Never brought a single piece of cloth from this store. Costco for me is mainly about food, which Walmart is selling for convenience only, so does Target these days. It is apples and oranges. Ask single and retired people how much are they are interested in Costco. It is a store for family. Even with family some products are better to buy in lower quantities for higher price than large quantity at Costco cheaper but let half perish without use. You want $40K salary and health coverage for everyone? Ask Costco to give employment for all "underpaid", unhappy Walmart employees. It is about business in the first place. You display primitive view on two great retailers just based on your political views. It's sick. Both bring products people want. I am happy them competing with each other.
Why would you support a company who's employees suck Medicaid and Food Stamp dollars ? Aren't those the people you wingnutz hate ?

Message.Title: gop tax policies have impovershed the nation, made the rich richer & everyone else poorer
Message.Msg: Fmr. Reagan budget director Stockman nailed it the other day: Bush's policies wrecked the nation. anyone can see that decades of tax cuts for the rich have not helped the economy: "Declining Tax Rates Haven’t Stimulated Investment: Cutting taxes on the richest Americans has not led them to invest more in plant and equipment. Over the past 50 years, as tax rates have declined, there has been no increase in investment spending as a percentage of GDP. (The flat trend line shows that changes in the highest marginal income-tax rate have not affected investment much, one way or the other.) Instead, the investment share of the economy has been determined by other factors, such as aggregate demand, rather than tax policy Lower Taxes, Slower GDP Growth: Despite lower and declining tax rates, especially on the rich, the United States has had slower productivity growth over the last several decades than other advanced economies. Overall, lower taxes are associated with slower growth in GDP per hour worked. A 10 percentage point increase in taxes as a share of GDP is associated with an increase in the productivity growth rate of 0.2 percentage points. (See Figure 5.) The Great Tax-Cut Experiment Has cutting tax rates for the rich helped the economy? GERALD FRIEDMAN is a professor of economics .

Topic.Title: everyone agrees: the gop are a bunch of inflexable jackarses

Message.Msg: Would you have rather we settled our differences with the Soviet Union by suckering them into an arms race they couldn't win or by lobbing nukes at each other until one side or the other can't lob? Almost ALL the extraordinary expenditures, be they under Roosevelt, Reagan, or Bush, were in response to attacks or serious threats on US Territory. The same can't be said for Obama. The only people who were in any danger when he started spending on that money were his wall street buddies (major campaign contributors to his re-election). So from Roosevelt we got rid of Fascism, with Reagan discredited communism in general and destroyed Soviet Communism, and with Bush we discredited the Arab Islamist movement, killed most of their leadership, particularly targeting those who spoke English, and instituted a series of ongoing policies against Al Queda that puts them in a "special place" in our national rules of engagement. With Obama we were fighting a market correction after the collapse of the bloated housing market, and the only thing people were in danger of loosing were their family fortunes. Who in the REAL world banks with Goldman Sachs or Lehman Brother or . . . well, you get the idea, so during 10 years of war during which Bush spent around 400 billion a year over budget and the Democrats HOWLED at the cost of it . . . Now we have a Democratic president that only has the ONE regional conflict, and that mostly wound down to training, an onging operation against Al Queda, but a SERIOUS problem in that alot of his buds are going to lose their butts when the national Autoworkers Unions had to admit they'd plundered the pension plans while GM had to admit they could afford the unions, well, let's just say alot of bodies would have come unburied. And the losses to Wall Street were they actually held ACCOUNTABLE for the bad market bets they made, well, that just couldn't be accepted because it would "constrict the money supply". (to his campaign coffers).

Terribly sorry about the "only race fit to rule thing", it was a natural mistake given the vast cities and infrastructure we found in the cradle of civilization when we came to visit. At that time only the most extended leg of the human Diaspora, the indigenous people of the Americas, were in an equally primitive state. So, you're from a civilization that has gone from bronze arrowheads to steel mail, swords, and firearms in the last 4,000 years what would you conclude? So, how is it that slavers from Europe were able to buy captives taken by African tribes as if they were cattle when had an African ship landed in Spain and asked for slaves well, the response would have been something other than "how much each?". In fact the questioner would probably have gotten a sharp yard of steel for his answer. Why is it that the former jewel of Africa, the nation of Rhodesia, once a HUGE agricultural exporter, is now a famine stricken land of poverty called Zimbabwe? How can a civilizat . . .er, no, not a civilization because there were no cities and no one was really civilized, but rather a GROUP of people go 50,000+ years and not advance until finally recontacted by the descendants of people who left the area around that time and find themselves thinking them wizards, gods, or demons? I know the Sahara is a significant barrier but why were there never any ships built to trade with the north? Certainly there must have been some value in the enterprise! (Despite the risks of sea travel in an era of shallow bottom barges). I wait with anticipation to see if the Union of South Africa goes the same way Zimbabwe did, are you willing to bet AGAINST it happening? Right now it could go either way, with one of the biggest moderating forces on the government right now being the attention of the world press.

Several teens were arrested after dozens of mob groups began attacking pedestrians on Chicago’s downtown Magnificent Mile area on Saturday night. Police responded to reports of disturbances near Michigan and Chicago Avenues. The teens charged with misdemeanor reckless conduct and battery and later released, according to News Affairs Officer Perkus. Eleven other teens were charged with the same misdemeanor charges after they attacked a group of women on the CTA Red Line, police said.

Message.Title: I wonder who won't be posting on this board anymore
Message.Msg: Sheriff's Office Says Autopsies Likely Will Have To Determine Cause Of Deaths The cause of the deaths of “Buckwild” cast member Shain Gandee and two others whose bodies were found in a vehicle likely will be determined in autopsies by the state’s chief medical examiner. Gandee’s body and that of his uncle, David, were found Monday in a Ford Bronco in a wooded area near Thaxton Hollow in Sissonville, according to a news release from the Kanawha County Sheriff’s Office. The sheriff’s office confirmed their identities, but said the third person found has not been positively identified. Family members said the third person is Robert Myers, 27. The sheriff’s office said there was no sign of foul play.

Topic.Title: Are white supremacists killing Texas prosecutors?

Message.Msg: as ususal, you have your head up your own rear end, you get a A for contortionism, and an F for trying to keep up with the real world. Here are the facts so far: "The lead suspect in the killings is a white supremacist prison gang called the Aryan Brotherhood of Texas. McLelland had said he believed the gang could have been responsible for Hasse's murder, noting that the group has a lot of members in the area and that his office has "put some real dents in the Aryan Brotherhood around here in the past year." A look at what authorities have so far gleaned about the Aryan Brotherhood's alleged involvement: First, McLelland wasn't exaggerating about the "dents." In July 2012, his office won a life sentence for an Aryan Brotherhood enforcer over a shoot-out with a wayward member in Terrell, Texas. The bigger hit to the gang, though, was an indictment unsealed in November against 34 alleged Aryan Brotherhood members, including four bosses. The multi-agency task force responsible for the indictment was based in Houston, but the Kaufman County D.A.'s office was among those credited for the "devastating blow." In December, the Texas Department of Public Safety issued a statewide warning that the Aryan Brotherhood might be "planning retaliation against law enforcement officials" who participated in the Houston case, adding that "high-ranking members" were "involved in issuing orders to inflict 'mass casualties or death' to law enforcement officials who were involved in cases where Aryan Brotherhood of Texas are facing life sentences or the death penalty." Hasse was not personally involved in the case, but he was gunned down on the same day two of the 34 Aryan Brotherhood members pleaded guilty to federal racketeering charges in Dallas. The FBI and Kaufman County officials are also looking for a connection to the March 19 shooting of Colorado prisons director Tom Clements. Clements, like the McLellands, was shot inside his home. The suspect, Evan S. Ebel, was killed in ne
